intro: Parodia grandiflora, commonly known as the "Candelabra Cactus," is a species native to southern Africa. It is a columnar cactus with a distinctive, branching structure that resembles a candlestick. The plant features cylindrical stems covered in white to pale blue spines and produces large, showy yellow flowers during the summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Its unique appearance and blooming habit make it a popular choice for desert gardens and cactus collections.
